{"step_by_step_thinking": "Guided Tissue Regeneration (GTR) is a procedure used in periodontal therapy to direct the growth of new bone and gingival tissue at sites having insufficient volumes or dimensions of bone or gingiva for proper function, aesthetics or prosthetic restoration. Resorbable GTR materials are those that the body can break down and absorb over time. Poly lactic acid, Poly galactic acid, and Polylactic acid, polyglycolic acid, and trimethylene carbonate are all resorbable materials. PTFE (Polytetrafluoroethylene) is a type of non-resorbable material.", "answer_choice": "D. PTFE"}
